title: D.H.S. Review Does Not Say Pretti Brandished Gun, As Noem Claimed
summary: An initial report from an internal agency watchdog says the Minneapolis man was shot by law enforcement after resisting arrest, but makes no mention of the allegations leveled by a Trump administration official.

title: Judge Temporarily Blocks Deportation of 5-Year-Old Detained by ICE in Minnesota
summary: An image of the boy, wearing a Spider-Man backpack as he was detained by federal agents, became a symbol of the immigration crackdown in Minnesota.

title: Republicans Shift Tone After Killings, Criticizing Trump’s Immigration Push
summary: With the president signaling a pivot in his crackdown, G.O.P. lawmakers have felt freer to express concern. But it’s not clear what they are willing to do about it.

title: Noem’s Handling of Shooting Put Her in Trump’s Penalty Box, but Just Briefly
summary: Kristi Noem’s aggressiveness has sometimes given President Trump heartburn. She got a rebuke after a second killing by federal immigration agents but soon seemed to be back in his good graces.

title: Democrats Push to Impeach DHS Secretary Kristi Noem After Minneapolis Shooting
summary: Following the fatal shooting in Minneapolis, a drive to impeach the homeland security secretary has drawn dozens more Democratic supporters, including the party’s top three leaders.

title: Dozens Arrested After Anti-ICE Protest at a Manhattan Hilton
summary: The demonstration at the TriBeCa hotel followed a similar targeting of a Hilton property in Minneapolis on Sunday.

title: Why Did the Trump Administration Silence Bovino on Social Media?
summary: When the border chief got yanked from Minnesota, he lost access to his X account, too.

title: Trump Threatens to Pull U.S. Help From Iraq if Former Leader Returns
summary: Nuri Kamal al-Maliki, a former prime minister, has been nominated to the post by the main Shiite Muslim bloc in the Iraqi Parliament.

title: Judge Revives Wind Farm That Trump Halted Off Martha’s Vineyard
summary: The project, known as Vineyard Wind, was already 95 percent complete when the Trump administration ordered construction to stop.

title: U.S. Expects to Finish Review of Epstein Files Soon, Bondi Says
summary: By law, the government was required to release its files on Jeffrey Epstein in December. Now the attorney general said they will be out “in the near term.”

title: As Trump Promotes Economy in Iowa, Many Residents Feel Pain
summary: Farmers are critical to Iowa’s economy. They have been battered by President Trump’s tariffs and are not experiencing the “golden age” that the president promised.

title: Democrats Restore Minnesota House to Even Split Amid Immigration Turmoil
summary: In special elections on Tuesday, Democrats won two left-leaning districts, preventing Republicans from holding a majority in the State House of Representatives.

title: These Foods Might Lower Cancer Risk
summary: Decades of research suggests that your diet can influence the risk of various cancers. Here’s what we know.

title: Safety Board Blames F.A.A. For Multiple Failures in D.C. Crash
summary: The National Transportation Safety Board found the probable causes of the midair collision last year included poorly designed flight routes and ignored warnings about risks.

title: She’s the Face of Trump’s Aviation Safety Board, and She’s a Democrat
summary: Jennifer Homendy, the outspoken chairwoman of the National Transportation Safety Board, is reclaiming the spotlight at a meeting on Tuesday about the Washington, D.C., crash that killed 67.

title: Troop Casualties in Ukraine War Near 2 Million, Study Finds
summary: The number of deaths, injuries and missing is approaching a grim milestone after nearly four years of fighting.

title: Another Weekend Winter Storm? Forecast Details and Updates.
summary: Meteorologists are watching another storm that could hit the East Coast this weekend.

title: Storm Tests Mamdani as Dangerous Cold Grips New York
summary: The death toll from the storm has risen to 10.  As it emerged  that some of the dead had prior contact with social service workers, Mayor Zohran Mamdani vowed to do more to get people into shelters.

title: Spain Offers Undocumented Migrants a Legal Way to Stay
summary: The measure, unexpectedly approved, comes as other countries are cracking down on immigration.

title: Bari Weiss Urges CBS News to Think Like a ‘Start-Up’
summary: “We are not producing a product enough people want,” Ms. Weiss told employees at her first all-staff meeting at the network.

title: Southwest Begins Assigned Seating, Scrapping a Signature Quirk
summary: The airline said its new policy, rolled out on Tuesday, responded to passengers’ preferences, but some customers said the scramble was part of the charm.

title: The Rise and Fall of South Korean First Lady Kim Keon Hee
summary: Kim Keon Hee was unlike any presidential spouse South Korea had seen. Her downfall, on corruption charges, came after her husband declared martial law.

title: Who Decides When a Home Is Safe? A California Bill Says Science, Not Insurers.
summary: Following a Times investigation, a state lawmaker is proposing the first health-based standards for assessing smoke contamination after wildfires.

title: Gladys West, Unsung Figure in Development of GPS, Dies at 95
summary: As a Navy mathematician in the 1950s and beyond, she played an unheralded but foundational role in making possible the global satellite-based mapping system.

title: Should Iran’s Executioners Go Unpunished?
summary: It’s left to the United States to impose meaningful consequences on the Iranian regime for one of the worst atrocities of this century.

title: Immigration Enforcement Is Unavoidably Upsetting. But This Is Something Else.
summary: Is this really the only way to enforce the law?

title: Former French Senator Convicted of Drugging a Colleague, Intending to Assault Her
summary: The trial took on special resonance in France, a year after a court found Dominique Pelicot and dozens of other men guilty of raping Gisèle Pelicot while she was sedated.

title: Tails of the City: San Francisco’s Latest Animal Sensation Is a Mountain Lion
summary: The 2-year-old male was safely captured after he got stuck between two apartment buildings.

title: Man Went on ‘Trial Run’ Before Killing 4 Homeless Men, Prosecutors Say
summary: Randy Rodriguez Santos faces four murder charges for the beating deaths of homeless men in Manhattan’s Chinatown in 2019. The killings left the city’s homeless population on edge.
